body.p: Respondents to the 2020 Exposure Draft generally supported and welcomed the transition proposals but asked the IASB to reconsider a specific aspect of the proposal that would require entities to reinstate particular discontinued hedging relationships. Specifically, these respondents highlighted circumstances in which reinstating discontinued hedging relationships would be challenging or have limited benefit—for example, when:

li.p: the hedging instruments or the hedged items in the discontinued hedging relationships have been subsequently designated into new hedging relationships;
the hedging instruments in the discontinued hedging relationships no longer exist at the date of initial application of the amendments—eg they have been terminated or sold; or
the hedging instruments in the discontinued hedging relationships are now being managed within a trading mandate with other trading positions and reported as trading instruments.
